revision.text:
'''WARM''' is an international foundation working on the world’s contemporary conflicts, based in [[Sarajevo]], Bosnia.
== Description ==
WARM is dedicated to war reporting and war art, as well as history and memories of war, and dedicated to the promotion of emerging talents and to education.<ref>[http://www.warmfoundation.org/about WARM]</ref>
WARM works to bring together people with a common passion for ‘telling the story with excellence and integrity'. It supports projects worldwide,<ref>[http://www.warmfoundation.org/projects WARM Projects]</ref> and is working on to open a WARM Center in Sarajevo.
The WARM community is an international network of reporters, artists, researchers and activists.<ref>[http://www.warmfoundation.org/members WARM Members]</ref>
== History ==
WARM started as a project during the "Sarajevo 2012" reunion of war reporters,<ref>Sarajevo 2012: http://www.warmfoundation.org/project/sarajevo-2012</ref> organized on April 6, 2012, for the 20th anniversary of the [[Bosnian war|war in Bosnia]].<ref>''It’s not hard to fall in love for Sarajevo'', Radio Sarajevo: http://www.radiosarajevo.ba/novost/77110/# {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102081921/http://www.radiosarajevo.ba/novost/77110/ |date=2013-11-02 }}</ref><ref>''Sarajevo was The Story Of Their Lives'', The Cutting Edge: http://www.thecuttingedgenews.com/index.php?article=72788</ref><ref>''Reporters de guerre(s)'', France Inter: http://www.franceinter.fr/emission-interception-reporters-de-guerres</ref><ref>''La guerre en Bosnie a provoqué un éveil des consciences'', France Info: http://www.franceinfo.fr/societe/les-choix-de-france-info/remy-ourdan-la-guerre-en-bosnie-a-provoque-un-eveil-des-consciences-766431-2012-10-12</ref>
WARM, founded and headed by ''[[Le Monde]]'' reporter [[Rémy Ourdan]],<ref>Rémy Ourdan: http://www.remyourdan.com/about/</ref> was launched in Sarajevo in 2013.<ref>WARM Launch Press Release: http://www.warmfoundation.org/news/08-04-2013-warm-launch-press-release</ref><ref>''War Reporters Network Launches in Sarajevo'', BIRN: http://www.warmfoundation.org/news/war-reporters-network-launches-sarajevo-birn</ref><ref>''The WARM Foundation: Telling the Story of Modern War'', The Huffington Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/kj-wetherholt/the-warm-foundation_b_3857148.html</ref><ref>''Telling their Story: Reflections on War'', PCRC blog: http://p-crc.org/telling-their-story-reflections-on-war/ {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141026181804/http://p-crc.org/telling-their-story-reflections-on-war/ |date=2014-10-26 }}</ref>
WARM is organizing an annual [[WARM Festival|festival]] in Sarajevo<ref>The First World WARM Festival: http://www.warmfoundation.org/warm-festival-2014</ref><ref>''Libyan Rebels Fly to Bosnia to see Revolution Film'', AP: http://www.warmfoundation.org/news/libyan-rebels-fly-to-bosnia-to-see-revolution-film-ap</ref><ref>WARM Festival 2015: http://www.warmfoundation.org/warm-festival-2015</ref> and is publishing a ''WARM Review''.<ref>WARM Review: http://www.warmfoundation.org/warm-review</ref><ref>''Editorial'', WARM Review #1: http://www.remyourdan.com/otherworks/2015-06-warm-review-1/</ref>
==External links==

{{Multiple issues| {{notability|date=April 2017}} {{Refimprove|date=September 2016}} {{Primary sources|date=September 2016}} {{COI|date=September 2016}}}} {{Infobox martial art | logo = Caligraphy WHD.jpg | logocaption = | logosize = | image =WHD1245.jpg | imagecaption = | imagesize = | name = Wonhwado | aka = Enwado, WHD, 원화도 | focus = Throwing, striking, locking submissions | hardness = Full contact, semi contact, light contact | country = South Korea {{flagicon|Korea}} | creator = [[Bong-Ki Han]] | formation = 1972 | website = http://wonhwado.org/ | meaning = The way of circular harmony }}
[[File:Great Grand Master Han.jpg|thumb|Grand Master Han Bong-Ki giving a lecture at the World Won Hwa Do Festival 1999]] '''Won Hwa Do'''(원화도) is a traditional [[Korean martial arts|Korean martial art]], founded in 1972 by [[Bong-Ki Han]]. The name in Korean (Hangul) means "The Way of Circular Harmony" (Won = Circle, Hwa = Harmony, Do = Way). The basis of the art lies in circular movement by effectively utilizing full 360° rotations of the human body motion. This helps in conserving energy and reducing the risk of injury on the practitioner's joints often caused by use of linear force and impact. Won Hwa Do is often compared to [[hapkido]] and [[Taekkyeon]] which are also national martial arts of Korea. Although similar in several aspects, Won Hwa Do's Ha-Dan/Sang-Dan Hoe-Jeon-Gong-Bang (하단/상단 회전공방) techniques are a unique trademark which is not shared by the other Korean martial arts. Ha-Dan Hoe-Jeon- Gong-Bang has the practitioner rotating arms in a forward motion and Sang-Dan has them rotating it in a backward motion. These two form the bases of strikes, throws, blocks, counters, submissions and kicks in its diverse self-defense system and are the most fundamental and basic practice of Won Hwa Do. The uniform pattern is also unique in that it contains diamond shaped patterns with green and maroon lines painted or sewn across it. Its belt system does not follow the traditional Japanese black belt curriculum and its forms ([[kata]]) are quite short in comparison to [[karate]], [[taekwondo]] and hapkido. Won Hwa Do is a very unorthodox martial art as demonstrated by its breaking away from these norms but takes pride in having its own unique standard.
== History == === Founding === [[File:Training in the early days.jpg|thumb|Cho and Han in the very beginning.]] Founded in 1972 by Bong-Ki Han Won Hwa Do's origins lie in traditional Korean prayer and dance. The prayer-like movements are known as Bison(비손) which has the practitioner moving his hands in a circular path against one another as if turning a wheel.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=http://www.mardb.com/wonhwado/ |title=WonHwaDo | Martial Arts Database |website=Mardb.com |date=2014-06-20 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> This idea represents the rotating of Yin Yang within a person's mind and body thereby bringing peace and harmony to him/her.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wonhwado.org/about |title=WonHwaDo.org |website=wonhwado.org |date= |accessdate=2017-01-06}}</ref> Won Hwa Do at one point had a team that performed Won Hwa Do dance alongside the Famous [[Little Angels Children's Folk Ballet of Korea|Little Angels Children's Folk Ballet]] of South Korea.
Han was a monk in a temple for a short while. It is assumed that his lifestyle from these times were a deep influence on how he chose to create Won Hwa Do's techniques. Ik-Hun Cho assisted Bong-Ki Han in the early days using experiences from his days as a master of other Korean martial arts. Many old photographs show the two of them travelling around Korea spreading WonHwaDo.
=== Central Training Center (Chilwon Dojang) === Bong-Ki Han and his main disciples established and built the Central Training center (Chilwon dojang) in 1994. There he held many workshops, seminars and even 100 day training camps. 100 day training camps were a common tradition for those training to attain the rank of Maroon Belt (Instructor) and beyond. In 1998 The World Won Hwa Do Festival was held in which people from all over the Asia and Europe participated.<ref>[http://wonhwado.homepage.tonline.de/PDF/Presse/bis_2000/1998_Bericht_2_Leadership_Conference.pdf] {{dead link|date=September 2016}}</ref> A follow up festival was held in the following year of 1999. It was from this Festival that Han sent European masters to back pioneer WonHwaDo in their homeland countries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wonhwado.homepage.t-online.de/PDF/Presse/bis_2000/1999_Bericht_2_Welt_Festival_1999.pdf |format=PDF |title=WonHwaDo Deutschland |website=Wonhwado.homepage.t-online.de |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Chilwon in Masan, [[Gyeongsang Province|GyeongSangDo]] Province was a forested area of the countryside of South Korea that Won Hwa Do used for all of its major events and training workshops. However, in 2004 the Chilwon dojang would close its doors and the WWF(World Won Hwa Do Federation) would move its headquarters to Seoul.
=== The World Won Hwa Do Federation === [[File:세계원화도연맹.jpg|thumb|World Won Hwa Do Federation established in 2003.]] In 2003 The World Won Hwa Do Federation(세계원화도연맹) was officially recognized and supported by the Korean Government as a national Martial Art.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.naver.com/main/read.nhn?mode=LSD&mid=sec&sid1=102&oid=003&aid=0002070199 |title=한성디지털大, 세계원화도연맹과 산학협력 체결 : 네이버 뉴스 |language=ko |website=News.naver.com |date=2008-04-29 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Won Hwa Do during this time became well established in European countries such as Germany, Slovakia, Lithuania and the United Kingdom. Won Hwa Do also began to grow steadily in Japan as well during this period. In the year 2004, [[Jeonju|Jeon Ju]](전주) Won Hwa Do training center was established by Ryu Jae Nam(류재남). After Bong-Ki Han's died in 2010 he left leadership of the World Won Hwa Do Federation to his son and other leaders. Shortly following his passing the Seoul Headquarters closed down and the training center in Jeon Ju became the WWF Headquarters.<ref name="원화도 세계무술소개 | 충주세계무술축제">{{cite web|url=http://www.martialarts.or.kr/bbs/board.php?bo_table=malist&wr_id=10 |title=원화도 > 세계무술소개 | 충주세계무술축제 |website=Martialarts.or.kr |date= |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Since Bong-Ki Han]s passing Ik-Hun Cho is the only person to attain the rank of Great Grand Master(Gold stripe). He helped develop, pioneer and create the many techniques of Won Hwa Do's diverse GongBang(공방) system.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.naver.com/kt2112?Redirect=Log&logNo=100029441867 |title=cheng : 네이버 블로그 |website=Blog.naver.com |date= |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref>
=== International development === Japan's Won Hwa Do headquarters are in [[Okayama]] prefecture but dojangs also exist in several locations across the country such as [[Nagoya]] and [[Osaka]]. Across Europe, several countries remain active albeit in a much smaller capacity than the early years of 2000. [[Austria]], [[Germany]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wonhwado.de/schulen.html |title=Schulen & Dojangs |website=Wonhwado.de |date=2015-10-27 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> [[Slovakia]], [[England]], [[Lithuania]] are among the few countries that still teach and practice Won Hwa Do. In order to help accelerate the growth of Wonhwado internationally,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wonhwado.de/PDF/Presse/2004/Mitteilungsblatt_BadLausick_19_2004.pdf |format=PDF |title=Angebote der Volkshochschule |website=Wonhwado.de |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Bong-Ki Han sent his disciples and students abroad to learn English whilst pioneering the art in those countries. Germany, Slovakia and England are a direct by-product of this time. Germany currently has 3 different dojangs with the headquarters being in Leipzig. [[File:WHD master seminar.jpg|thumb|Seminar in Austria with many Masters from Korea.]]
== Philosophy == Circular motion to harmonise with the Universe, Heaven, People, Nature. The concept is based around the idea that all straight lines are destined to begin and end whilst circular force and motion naturally flows without ceasing.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Song|first1=Hugo|title=Mr|url=http://wonhwado.org/about/philosophy|website=www.wonhwado.org|accessdate=27 April 2017}}</ref>
== Techniques and curriculum == Won Hwa Do is considered to be a diverse and versatile martial art. For example, it employs grappling techniques for throwing and locking submissions but also has striking with punches and kicks. However, all of these diverse techniques still revolve around the fundamental principles of circular motion.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZtpCQT3tNIE&t=19s |title=Remembering Grand Master Han Bong-Ki (원화도) (圓和道) English Subtiles |publisher=[[YouTube]] |date=2016-09-01 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Won Hwa Do has a term for its techniques known as 'Gongbang'(공방). The [[Hangul]] (Korean characters) for Gong(공) means offense whilst the Hangul for Bang(방)<ref name="원화도 세계무술소개 | 충주세계무술축제"/> means defense. Won Hwa Do teaches to practice offense and defense simultaneously in one movement through the use of circular motion. Although seemingly peaceful, meditative and harmless in appearance the force from the circular Hadan (forward circular) strike carries a formidable impact on the target. The force comes from the theory of infusing pushing and pulling into one circular strike as if striking with a ball and chain flail weapon swinging at the end of a handle. Cho Ik Hun teaches that force and technique in the Hadan strike comes not from observation and talent but pure and patient practice of the basic Hadan circular movement for many years. He also emphasizes the importance of breathing and core hip strength in mastering the technique.

=== Forms (Kata) (기본형) === Won Hwa Do has 40 Basic Forms, <ref name="auto"/> The first set are separated into 4 directions forward, left, back and right. The second set of 20 forms consist of diagonal directions of movement. <ref>이현히교사 (1997) 원화도 교본</ref>
Jeong-Myeon-Gong-Bang(정면공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 [[File:WHD Form 3.jpg|thumb|Master Kim Kook Sun demonstrating Jeong Myeon GongBang No.3]]
Pyeong-Woe-Gong-Bang(평외공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
Hu-Myeon-Gong-Bang(후면공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 [[File:Form 11.jpg|thumb|Master Kim Kook Sun demonstrating Hu Myun GongBang No.1]]
Pyeong-Nae-Gong-Bang(평내공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 [[File:Form 19.jpg|thumb|Master Kim Kook Sun demonstrating Pyeong Nae GongBang No.4]]
Cheuk-Woe-Gong-Bang(측외공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
Cheuk-Nae-Gong-Bang(측내공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
Cheuk-waeGong-Bang (주외공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
Ju-Nae-GongBang (주내공방) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
Each form also has various striking, kicking, throwing, submission and locking techniques using the footwork, direction and movements based on the form.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.de/Die-koreanische-Kampfkunst-WonHwaDo-Anf%C3%A4nger/dp/3844817417 |title=Die koreanische Kampfkunst WonHwaDo für Anfänger: Amazon.de: Lutz Winter: Bücher |website=Amazon.de |date= |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref>
=== Belt structure === Won Hwa Do has a different belt system to other martial arts like [[judo]], karate, taekwondo and hapkido. For example, usually in traditional martial arts like Karate the [[Black belt (martial arts)|black belt]] is the symbol of an instructor or high level practitioner. However, in Won Hwa Do a person of high rank and skill wears a maroon-colored belt. The reason behind Won Hwa Do's choice of colors is that Karate's black system was rooted in Japan's martial arts history whereas Won Hwa Do chooses to base its system on Korea's [[Joseon|Joseon Dynasty]] era. For example, common folk wore plain white Han boks (Korean traditional clothing) whilst captains and commanders of the military wore blue and red. Generals and Politicians would often wear purple or maroon-colored [[Hanbok|Han boks]] with blue, green and golden patterns.<ref name="Belt-structure">{{cite web|url=http://wonhwado.org/about/belt-system |title=WonHwaDo belt system |website=wonhwado.org |date= |accessdate=2017-07-24}}</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Belt !Korean!! Detail !! Rank !! Color |- | White Belt ||| Start from the very basics and move forward || Beginner || {{color box|white}} |- | Green Belt |형화 (形和)|| Require up to 3 blue stripes before taking blue belt test || Intermediate || {{color box|green}} |- | Blue Belt |역화(力和)|| Require up to 3 red stripes before taking blue belt test || Captain || {{color box|blue}} |- | Red Belt |성화(成和)|| Require up to 3 maroon (or purple) stripes before taking Maroon belt test || Assistant Instructor || {{color box|red}} |- | Maroon Belt |정화(淨和)|| Required to know all forms and how to apply their movements in self-defense efficiently || Instructor || {{color box|maroon}} |- | Maroon Belt with Green stripe ||| Can have up to 2 green stripes before taking Master level || Elder instructor || {{color box|maroon}} |- | Maroon Belt with Green Line |인화(仁和)|| Required to coach and train Maroon belt level practitioners and below || Master || {{color box|maroon}}{{color box|green}} |- | Maroon Belt with Blue Line |충화(忠和)|| Can only be approved by the World Won Hwa Do Federation || Master || {{color box|maroon}}{{color box|blue}} |- | Maroon Belt with White Line |원화(圓和)|| Shihan level. Guiding Masters and Grand Masters || Grand Master || {{color box|maroon}}{{color box|white}} |- | Maroon Belt with Gold Line |심전원화(心田圓和)|| Highest possible level || Great Grand Master || {{color box|maroon}}{{color box|yellow}} |}
Although depending on the country system varies, the system displayed above is the general standard.
Han and Cho prefer being called by the title of simply 'Grand Master' or Teacher (seonsaengnim, 선생님) as they deem 'Great Grand Master' too long-winded.
After the death of Bong-Ki Han, Ik-Hun Cho is the only one to hold the rank of Maroon (purple) gold Grandmaster belt.
[[File:Han Cho.jpg|thumb|Grand Master Cho and Grand Master Han developed Won Hwa Do together in the early years.]]
